content: alice flower square designed by ilse beulens from my cro-shed skill level confident beginner yarn i used yarn and colors must-have 100% mercerized cotton 50g 125m 1 75oz 137yd in the following colors a cream b rosé / pea green / larimar c light pink / eucalyptus /ice blue feel free to use whatever yarn or colors you prefer other things you ll need i used a 3 5mm hook your hook size will depend on the yarn you use so check the label for the right size you also need a darning needle and a pair of scissors notes i choose to start every round with a standing stitch and close it with an invisible join in the second stitch if you prefer you can start with a chain start and close with a slip_stitch in the first stitch a magic_ring can be replaced with a chain 3 and slip_stitch in first chain a double_crochet with a chain 3 and a half_double_crochet with a chain 2 weave in your ends at the end of a round it s not only easier to work it also saves you from lots of unpleasant work when your square is finished for some rounds it s not so easy to weave in your ends immediately then it s best to wait until the next round abbreviations us terms round round ** repeats for the whole round amount of stitches to be made in the same stitch small repeats amount of stitches per round or side repeat repeat fo fasten_off inv join invisible join magic_ring magic_ring chain chain
